comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: A painting of this view by H Stuart Wilson (1902) referred from the 'Equivalents' series [pellethepoet and State Library of NSW]: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=863043

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Ha! Glad someone's been appreciating my little gatherings.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/galleries/72157624765851888/]

John Degotardi junior took a whole series of photos from this spot. It's as if he was stopped in his tracks by a premonition of the Cahill Expressway!
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/4863069426/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: John Degotardi Junior did a great job with the composition of this photo and many others.  It really does not look like a rat-infested slum in need of demolition.  He did well to inspire so many later paintings.
